title: How a Zombie Movie Changed Horror for Girls
summary: A long time ago, a girl watched a scary movie called 28 Days Later. It was about zombies and a virus that made people angry. She liked it because the women in the movie were strong and smart, not just scared. This was different from other horror movies where girls were often just there to be scared. Now, after many years, a new movie in this series is out. It is called 28 Years Later: The Bone Temple and is directed by a woman named Nia DaCosta. She loved the old movie too and wanted to make a new one that keeps the strong women. The new movie has a girl named Jimmy Ink who helps a boy survive. This shows how horror movies can be fun and fair for everyone.

background_read: Horror movies are films that try to scare people with monsters, ghosts, or scary stories. They often have characters who run away from danger. In the past, many horror movies showed girls as very scared and weak, but some new movies are changing this to make girls strong and brave too. This article talks about how one movie series is doing this to make horror fun for everyone, especially girls who like scary movies.
Article_Structure: WHO: A girl who watched 28 Days Later and Nia DaCosta, the director of the new movie.
WHAT: How the 28 Days Later movies show strong women in horror films.
WHERE: In movies set in the UK, with zombies and viruses.
WHY: To make horror movies better for female fans by having fair and interesting women characters.

perspectives.description: They enjoy movies where women are shown as strong and important, not just scared.
